pageTitle: Opinions mixed on new subdivision ordinance | GalaxGazette.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {19794=HILLSVILLE — One Carroll County supervisor had concerns about road standards for a new kind of subdivision and a citizen made several objections at the April 14 board meeting, but all other speakers and county officials addressing proposed changes to the subdivision ordinance supported the new ideas. Carroll supervisors dealt with several subdivision ordinance modifications at the March meeting, but put on hold decisions involving the creation of a class C subdivision and flag lots., 25385=The Gazette | circulation@galaxgazette.com | 276-236-5178 ex 204 P.O. Box 68, 108 West Stuart Drive, Galax, VA 24333 Office Hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, 33604=Copyright © 2015 The Galax Gazette is your source for local news, sports, events and information in Galax, Grayson, Carroll, and surrounding areas.}
